page.title: 09THE BUILDINGS OF ALDERTON
page.content: Our square included most of the village of Alderton and we undertook a survey of the buildings. We counted 125 buildings of which 120 were private dwellings. The other 5 were a shop, barn, school, village hall and a church. These other buildings constituted the amenities of the village apart from a public house which was outside our square. We sorted the private dwellings into 4 categories, detached & semi-detached houses, terraced houses and bungalows. We found that there were almost equal numbers of each category except for terraced houses of which there were only 20. These were older, terraced cottages in the village centre. Over half the houses surveyed were new, having been built in the last 20 years. Of the remainder only 21 were considered to be over 100 years old.
